title: List of companies based in the Jacksonville area
text:
This is a list of companies either based or with large operation divisions in the <a href="Jacksonville">Jacksonville</a>/<a href="Northeast%20Florida">Northeast Florida</a> area of the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
Economic overview.
<a href="Harbor">Harbor</a> improvements since the late 19th century have made Jacksonville a major military and civilian <a href="deep-water%20port">deep-water port</a>. Its riverine location facilitates two <a href="U.S.%20Navy">U.S. Navy</a> bases and the <a href="Port%20of%20Jacksonville">Port of Jacksonville</a>, Florida's third largest <a href="seaport">seaport</a>.
Interstate Highways <a href="Interstate%2010%20in%20Florida">10</a> and <a href="Interstate%2095%20in%20Florida">95</a> intersect in Jacksonville, creating the busiest intersection in the region with 200,000 vehicles each day. Interstate 10 ends at this intersection (the other end being in <a href="Santa%20Monica%2C%20California">Santa Monica, California</a>).
Three significant freight railroads call Jacksonville home, and there are four public airports available: <a href="Jacksonville%20International%20Airport">Jacksonville International Airport</a>, <a href="Jacksonville%20Executive%20at%20Craig%20Airport">Jacksonville Executive at Craig Airport</a>, <a href="Herlong%20Recreational%20Airport">Herlong Recreational Airport</a> and <a href="Cecil%20Airport">Cecil Airport</a> at <a href="Cecil%20Commerce%20Center">Cecil Commerce Center</a>.
To emphasize the city's transportation capabilities, the Jacksonville Regional Chamber of Commerce filed "Jacksonville America's Logistics Center" as a trademark on November 9, 2007. It was formally registered on August 4, 2009. Cornerstone began promoting the city as "Jacksonville: America's Logistics Center" in 2009. Signs were added to the existing city limit markers on Interstate 95.
Significant factors in the local economy include <a href="Service%20sector">services</a> such as <a href="banking">banking</a>, <a href="Insurance%20industry">insurance</a>, and <a href="healthcare">healthcare</a>.
As with much of Florida, <a href="tourism">tourism</a> is also important to the Jacksonville area, particularly tourism related to <a href="golf">golf</a>.
Strong presence in Jacksonville.
The following notable businesses and organizations can be found in the <a href="Jacksonville%2C%20Florida">Jacksonville, Florida</a> area. Companies in bold with an asterisk (*) indicates a major employer in excess of 2,000 employees:
